constituent: dye, water, water droplets, water pistol, nine, baseball, tree, wood
heisigStory: Water . . . nine . . . tree. From those elements you must compose a plot for the key word, dye. Here, as elsewhere, any of the alternate meanings of the primitives may be used, provided they do not require a position other than that of the kanji in question.
hint: The baseball team hangs their freshly dyed dripping jerseys at the top of a tree to dry.
koohiiStory1: To make this dye, I used water and the barks of nine different trees.
koohiiStory2: The baseball team hangs their freshly dyed dripping jerseys at the top of a tree to dry.
kunYomi: そ.める、-ぞ.め、-ぞめ、そ.まる、し.みる、-じ.みる、し.み、-し.める
readingExamples: 染み (し.み), 染みる (し.みる), 染まる (そ.まる), 染める (そ.める)
